intro: Hypoestes annua, commonly known as the stormy petunia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, colorful bracts that resemble petals. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue, surrounded by showy, colorful leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant appearance. Hypoestes annua is relatively easy to grow and prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
